jokes.text: q. How do you comfort a JavaScript bug? a. You console it.

question.text: How do you comfort a JavaScript bug?

answer.text: You console it.

jokes.text: q. Why did the child component have such great self-esteem? a. Because its parent kept giving it `props`!

question.text: Why did the child component have such great self-esteem?

jokes.text: q. Why do C# and Java developers keep breaking their keyboards? a. Because they use a strongly typed language!

jokes.text: When a JavaScript date has gone bad, "Don't call me, I'll callback you. I promise!"

jokes.text: Dev1 saw a strange JavaScript function & asked, "What is this?". Dev2 responded, "I don't know. I would've called you, but I was in a bind"
Two JavaScript developers walked into the variable `bar`. Ouch!
